Oracle Table.Description: Nervous eye twitch or head tilt
Sniffs people or objects before interacting with them
Only drinks from a single personal ale horn or water skin
Rolls two or three iron stones around in one hand
Never removes their helmet and face plate
Only eats meat from an animal they have personally killed
Refrains from touching others and shirks away from touch
Constantly rubs hands as if wiping off blood
Scratches head or pulls on hair often
Readjusts armor buckles or weapon belt frequently
Constantly looking over their shoulder as if being followed
Always takes a deep breath and pauses before speaking as if straining to speak plainly
Squints and smiles oddly when talking
Cannot look another person in the eye
Does not laugh at jokes or even understand humor
Breathes heavily and rubs their chest as if a weight is pressing down on them
Plays with a dagger or arrow head when speaking
Being in a crowd or large group of people
Storms, particularly with thunder and lightning
Water, particularly deep and murky pools
The opposite or a different gender
Flowing water, particularly swift rivers or rapids
Precipitation, particularly torrential rains or sleet
Taps iron three times when expressing a hope or desire
Performs weapon flourish or routine before every battle
Lies about small and inconsequential things
Must have an open flame of some kind nearby
Cuts patterns into their own skin
Draws sigils of an unknown origin on flat surfaces
Scrubs skin at an old wound site
Rolls bones with fate runes on them before making decisions
Pours out containers of liquid if left unattended
Bites nails or skin to the point of self-harm
Blurts out stream of consciousness thoughts
Washes, shaves, or cleans to the point of self-harm
Performs ritualistic prayer over every dead animal body
Repeating minor actions a specific number of times
Streak of odd color in their hair
Scars that form an odd shape or pattern
Birthmark that resembles an evil symbol
Pock marks in a disquieting configuration
Skin of an unnatural color as if dyed or tattooed
Fully white eyes that lack an iris or pupil
Wounds that fester and wonâ€™t heal
Disproportionate body part (much stronger sword arm, etc.)
Skin unnaturally hot or cold to the touch
Eyes permanently closed yet still seeing
Sudden change in height, stature, or body composition
Joints that bend further than normally possible
Inability to use a body part except at certain times
Shadow that wavers as if in a haze of heat
Shadow that moves independent of a light source
Shadow that appears to be of a different creature
Elongated fingers or claws of a beast
Hair and clothes are suspended in the air as if in water
Glowing sigil or glyph on the body
Flames and smokes always bends towards them
Steam or smoke rises from their footsteps
A ghostly visage transposed over their face
Flames leap higher when close to their skin
Guilt and remorse accompanied by a need to confess
What physical objects need to be gathered or protected?
What new relationships must be forged, tested or broken?
What help needs to be gathered (such as skilled craftspeople or master mystics)?
How can you mitigate the immediate consequences of actions taken so far in the conflict?
How can you implement a plan to prevent this conflict from happening again?
What surrounding communities need to be informed of this conflict for their own safety?
What motives need to be understood or expectations need to be met in order to facilitate progress?
What are the implications of this conflict being resolved?  What new problems will that make?
What restitution or recompense need to be made?
In what way can a compromise be made?  Or in what way can all sides lose the least?
What third party wants your vow to fail?  What might they do?
What dangers exist in the nearby environment?
What trouble has befallen an ally related to this vow?
What makes navigation difficult in this area?
What makes you think that you don't have the full story?
What cultural taboo impedes your progress?
What mystic anomaly stands in your way?
What predatory creatures are known to prowl this area?
What did an ally do that unintentionally made things worse?
What vital item just went missing?
Another overseer works against you. What justification do they have for opposing you?
A crime is committed while you are working towards your vow. Is it related?
The guardian of a prominent citizen views your actions as a threat.  Why?
An ally or companion has turned against you.  What is it they fear will be the consequence of you fulfilling your vow?
Another warrior seeks to accomplish the same goal before you.  What's in it for them?
Time is the critical factor.  What happens if it takes too long to fulfill your vow?
A rival wants to see you fail.  What occurred between you in the past that they hold a grudge?
A mystic seer has a vision foretelling your failure.  What fate do they see lies ahead for you?
You must access a specific location.  Why is it necessary, and what is dangerous there?
You need a specific item or special permission.  Why is it difficult to obtain?
An oathbreaker opposes you.  How may your failure lead to their redemption?
A secret society opposes you.  How do they benefit from the conflict?
A zealot feels you are not devout enough and opposes you.  Why do people follow this zealot?
An Ironlander is under a curse or geas to work against you.  Who did this to them and why?
You are hunted by an assassin.  What crime are you accused of, and did you do it?
A malevolent curse on the land slowly grows in power.  What effect does it have, and who enacted it?
A conspiracy undermines your progress.  Why?  What do they stand to gain?
A sentient artifact or malevolent force of will works against you.  Why, and what is their goal?
The spirit of a dead ally or family member haunts you about this quest.  How were they involved?
An enigmatic mystic wants power for themself.  How does their goal conflict with yours?
Destroy a small shrine to an evil entity.
Destroy a watch tower the raiders use.
Destroy the source of malevolent magic.
Settle a blood feud between families.
Stop the skirmishes between two hostile settlements.
Unite the three clans of the valley.
Make peace with a violent second wave of Old World refugees.
Gather several herbs and find the alchemist.
Gather components and complete a mystic ritual of cleansing.
Find the nature and cure for a mystic plague.
Find the nature and cure for a powerful curse.
Defend the settlement from a band of raiders.
Defend the settlement from a besieging war band.
Defend the region from the expansion of varou territory.
Defend the Ironlands from the unending horde of horrors from the Shattered Wastes.
Catch the leader of a slave trade.
Catch the mystic who unleashed the Thanosian Plague.
Establish a watch tower on a border.
Establish safe routes for local trade.
Gather skilled artisans and warriors to become a cultural hub of the region.
Establish one overseer to rule them all.
Help a family reclaim confiscated land.
Assist an ally in becoming overseer at the upcoming conclave.
Free the people of the dogma enforced by the iron priests.
Reclaim independence for the Ironlands from their firstborn oppressors.
Recover a family heirloom from the battlefield.
Recover the armor forged by your ancestors.
Find and repair an ancient weapon of tremendous power.
Gather the full regalia of the last king of the Old World.
Rescue a lost and imperiled huntsman.
Rescue the druid imprisoned by the firstborn.
Free the spirit of your parent being tormented in the afterlife.
Slay Ormsliki the king of wyverns.
Find out who the killer is before they strike again.
Find out who stole the valuable relic and return it.
Find out who is blackmailing a prominent citizen and set it right.
Find out who is supplying the enemy with weapons or information and put it to an end.
Find out who set a curse upon the settlement and reverse it.
Find out why a settlement or building was destroyed or abandoned and make sure it won't happen again.
Broken blade with a missing hilt
Circle of salt disturbed in one direction
Forge tongs made of an unknown material
Small crate broken on the ground
Cracked clay pot depicting a battle
Iron urn with a recognizable symbol
Compass with the iron needle missing
Iron key with a bestial head
Dice made of bone and etched with runes
Evidence of a ritual gone wrong
Remains of a thick, viscous poison
Lock of hair tied in a leather thong
Shovel next to freshly churned earth
Blanket and supplies left by a smoldering fire
Broken belt buckle and leather bits
Whetstone with an etched sigil on the back
Elven mask of a precious wood
Talisman with a torn and bloodied chain
Small nub of a burnt candle of unusual color
Flute carved of a sacred wood
Crude map of a partially explored site
Small stones arranged in a circle
List of names with some scratched off
Materials for a tent or other temporary shelter
Iron key with a skull head
Banner for a nearby clan or settlement
Tally marks scratched in a surface

Oracles.Name: Mystery Vow: Who Committed the Crime

Oracle Table.Description: Ally or rival from your past

Oracles.Name: Mystery Vow: Why the Crime was Committed

Oracle Table.Description: A suspicious aspect in the appearance of
An odd connection between a PC and
An odd connection between an NPC and
A local legend or gossip about
A recent emotional or material loss involving
A recent change in power or authority involving
A tool used in the crime
A previously unknown locaiton of significance
A relative of a primary victim
A site or relic of power
Evidence has been destroyed.  Who or what destroyed this evidence and why would they support the criminal?
A person with information is unwilling to share it with you.  What task must you complete to earn their trust or pay for the information?
You find out that you don't have the permission, standing, or power to go someplace you need to investigate.  How can you show that you are worthy to access such a location?
The pressure mounts as the evidence you just uncovered shows that the mystery must be solved soon lest an irrevocable change or evil deed make the investigation moot.  What is the impending event?
The questions you ask or places that you go are considered taboo.  How can you get the information you need without offending people?
The criminal is being harbored by some faction or group.  What is this group's connection to your past that will make them difficult to deal with?
You find out that if the criminal is caught, an innocent person will likely suffer.  How is this innocent entangled in the mystery?
A suspect sent someone or something to stop you from investigating any further.  What is this opposing force, and how far are they willing to go to stop you?
A conflict from your past has arisen at just the wrong time.  What was that conflict, and how is it now impeding your progress?
You find evidence that a primary suspect is actually innocent, and now they see it as a point of honor to oppose you.  Despite their innocence, what special information do they hold?

A group of warriors have tracked you and accuse you of a crime.  You came to this Location for proof of your innocence.  What evidence do you need, and who else will suffer consequences if you are found guilty?
Bandits have absconded with the Horn of Paragons.  What does the horn do, and who wants to use it?
A cult of zealots has taken the iron priest and the Iron Star Staff to conduct a nefarious ritual during the full moon.  What is the cult's goal, and who will suffer the most if they succeed?
The murderer continues to evade you and may yet escape.  Who did they kill, and why do you feel like it is your fault?
A group of Skulde threaten the area wielding strange powers.  What is the power, and who do they prey on?
A curse has befallen your banner-kin that causes them to freeze in place for irregular amounts of time.  Who placed this curse, and what is needed to reverse it?
A band of firstborn claim their god has returned and demands sacrifice.  Who did they take for these sacrifices, and what happens if the sacrifices are completed?

A mystic commits dark experiments on Ironlanders seeking to unravel the secret to immortality.  What unnatural consequences have there been to these experiments, and who is now held captive by the mystic?
A family heirloom was lost when a warrior fell at a great battle and must be returned to blood-kin.  Why was the battle significant, and in what way did it change the landscape forever?
Raiders have decimated the population and food stores of a settlement.  Where is the nearest shelter for the survivors, and how is the leader of the raiders connected to you?
A cavern lit by glowing lichen holds an abandoned city.  The ground shakes, and buildings begin to crumble.
A keep built by the firstborn centuries ago now overtaken by nature.  Vines grasp at you, wrapping about your legs and feet.
A steep peak carved in the image of a great beast.  The ground gives way beneath you.
A ship breached by an iceberg among the Barrier Islands.  Icy water sloshes over your feet.
A village suspended above a waterfall and connected by rope bridges.  Your bridge has just been cut loose.
Several miles down a sink hole with carved alcoves and passageways.  You have disturbed something best left to slumber.
A settlement gripped by the plague and surrounded by warriors enforcing isolation.  Weakened villages have just charged to breach the quarantine.
The site of a half-buried ancient and sprawling mechanism of war with markings from the Old World.  Symbols glow and deep rumbling begins.
A pit used as a fighting circle.  A challenger faces you while stoic spectators chant slowly, eagerly awaiting the outcome and will of the gods.

In the midst of four burial mounds, each with a darkened portal to the sacred places within.  A foul stench emits from the entrances along with an unnaturally strong gust of wind while the dead shamble out.
Feral screams of the broken sound all around.
You just found a corpse.  Time is running out for the hostages.
An unnatural storm rages and intensifies.
An ally who you were sworn to protect has just disappeared.
Your banner leader has fallen, plunging the clan into turmoil and in-fighting.
Arcane chanting is carried to you by the wind, and the pungent smell of hot iron fills the air.

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: What the Monster Did

Oracle Table.Description: Brought a mystical malady or curse upon the community

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: How People Tried to Stop It
Monster Hunting: Dominant Attitude of the People

Oracle Table.Description: Disgusted by the monster or ignoring it

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: Likelihood of Correct Size
Monster Hunting: Likelihood of Correct Primary Form
Monster Hunting: Likelihood of Correct Characteristic
Monster Hunting: Likelihood of Correct Ability

Oracle Table.Description: Guides the monster's attacks toward specific people
Goads the monster to attack more frequently
Attempts to lure the monster to a new settlement
Disrupts attempts to hunt the monster
Enhances the monster with mystical power
Because they are under a dark geas
To cover up a previous crime
A dabbler in dark or forbidden arts
A firstborn who only now reveals themself
A sea captain with a weathered map
Build walls around the settlement and leave the monster alone
Sedate the monster for a time before killing it
Guide the monster to a safer location
Take away the monster's greatest weapon and then leave it alone
Abandon the settlement to the monster
Kill the monster but take its offspring
To complete an important ritual for the settlement
To enact the next step in a secret plot
To find a hidden relic of the Old World

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: Mounting Pressure Monster Desire

Oracle Table.Description: Build a new lair or nest
Connect with others of its kind
The settlement is located in the way
A hunter took down its prey
A small group accidentally harmed it
It got injured by a hunting trap
A small group unknowingly offended it through action or trespass
A small group took aggressive action against it for sport
A small group gathered its last food
A small group disturbed its lair or nest

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: Mounting Pressure Getting Worse

Oracle Table.Description: The monster is growing in size
Competing monsters are on the way
The monster is aging and desperate
The monster is poisoned and desperate
The monster is mutating and gaining new abilities

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: End the Fight Hit

Oracle Table.Description: Falls unconscious and is at your mercy.
Has you at its mercy but fails to follow through and then calmly retreats.
Is maimed and no longer poses a threat.
Is gravely injured and lays dying.
Loses its most powerful weapon or attack and is impotent in the fight.
Obtains a recognizable injury and flees in fear.
Realizes it has lost this battle and flees in a rage to regroup.
Changes its stance from aggressive to grudging respect and ceases its attack.

Oracles.Name: Monster Hunting: End the Fight Weak Hit But

Oracle Table.Description: It's worse than you thought: Endure Harm.
Your victory is short-lived: A new danger or foe appears, or an existing danger worsens.
You suffer collateral damage: Something of value is lost or broken, or someone important must pay the cost.
You'll pay for it: An objective falls out of reach.
Others won't forget: You are marked for vengeance.
You are tainted: The monster marks, infects, or curses you in some recognizable way.
The settlement still suffers: Another incident has occurred at the settlement.  Roll for an Action and Theme using the oracles in the Ironsworn core rules.
The plot thickens: Roll for an Aspect and Focus using the oracles in Ironsworn: Delve.

You are viewed as ruthless or distasteful: If you have a bond with the settlement or someone closely involved with this monster hunt, Test Your Bond.  Otherwise, you may not Sojourn in the settlement after this fight.
Can easily overwhelm its sense of smell
Black iron weapons are particularly effective
Will drop every other pursuit for a specific food
A particular herb is poisonous to it
It has allergic reactions to a specific substance
Easily stunned if hit directly on a specific body part
Can be goaded into charging blindly
Becomes lethargic in extreme heat or cold
Does not think in three dimensions; It never looks up
Becomes docile and submissive if bound
Blood of a different creature acts as acid to this one
Unleash a horror not seen before
Isolate an important person or community
Reveal the true nature or source of power

Oracles.Name: Advance Threat: Undead Uprising Accompanying Sign or Portent

Oracle Table.Description: Feelings of suffocation and anxiety attacks
Trade caravan being ambushed right now
Religious leader in conflict with overseer
Residents too infirm to care for themselves
Strange formation carved in the hillside
Need to create safe trade route
Mystic trapped in the throes of a ritual
Citizen who was lost returns but can't speak
Need impartial judge for a trial
Discover the truth of their past
Stay true to friends and family
A recent change in their own family
A recent change in the family of an NPC
Information that has recently been lost
Information that was lost when coming from the Old World
Information that has recently been discovered
A PC secret that has been made known
An enemy secret that has been made known
Gossip about shamed Ironlanders and forsaken vows
Why the leadership needs to change
Particular skills of a trade or craft
Particular equipment of a trade or craft
Small jobs or quests that need to be done
A recent inaction and the consequences
The decline of the Old World as told to them in childhood
A minor plot point involving an iron vow
A major plot point involving an iron vow
A connection between an NPC and
A connection between a PC and
A connection between an antagonist and
The loss of an ability involving
The acquisition of an ability involving
The truth is the exact opposite of what the PCs thought about
a safe location for the PCs
a dangerous location for the PCs
an enemy who is now an ally
a necessary artifact for fulfilling a vow
a necessary object to complete a vow
the road or passage to the next location
a special status for a PC
a special status for an NPC
a special status for a main antagonist
a group supportive to the PCs
a person with vital information about a formidable or lower vow
an oppositional group that is not a main antagonist
a person with vital information about an extreme or epic vow
a previously unknown character connected to the plot
a foundational truth of the world
Shift focus to someone or something else.
Destroy something, or render it useless.
Use the terrain to gain advantage.
Leverage the advantage of a weapon or ability.
Offer a quick and clean kill
Command others to fight in their stead
Release someone or something as a distraction
Give a choice of who or what to save (Trolley problem)
Offer to surrender for a price
Disengage and show no further aggression
Reveal a connection to an ally
Wait for opponent to make the next move
Drag out the fight to wear the opponent down
Use the circumstances of the battle to gain an advantage
Make several attacks in quick succession
Your ritual has the opposite affect.
Your friend, ally, or companion is adversely affected.
You collapse, and drift into a troubled sleep.
You undergo a physical torment which leaves its mark upon you.
You hear ghostly voices whispering of dark portents.
You are lost in shadow, and find yourself in another place without memory of how you got there.
You alert someone or something to your presence.
You are not yourself, and act against a friend, ally, or companion.
You affect or damage your surroundings, causing a disturbance or potential harm.
You suffer the loss of a sense for several hours.
You lose your connection to magic for a day or so, and cannot perform rituals.
Your ritual affects the target in an unexpected and problematic way.
Your ritual reveals a surprising and troubling truth.
You are tempted by dark powers.
You see a troubling vision of your future.
You can't perform this ritual again until you acquire an important component.
You develop a strange fear or compulsion.
Your ritual causes creatures to exhibit strange or aggressive behavior.
You are tormented by an apparition from your past.
You are wracked with sudden sickness.
Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse.
Your ritual affects the wrong target.
You become obsessed with performing more and more powerful rituals for a time.
A nearby innocent is adversely affected.
You inadvertently create a horror near a place or person you share a bond with.
Your spirit leaves your body and wanders for a time.
You undergo a mental torment which leaves its mark upon you.
You have a vision of two possible futures: one dark and the other darker still.
Your ritual binds you to the target in an unexpected and problematic way.
You draw out a nearby beast.
You inadvertently cause a friend, ally, or companion to act against you.
Your ritual causes a friend, ally, or companion to exhibit strange or aggressive behavior.
You lose your sense of discernment and become impulsive for several hours.
You collapse and awake days later.
You are tempted by greed or lust.
Your ritual reveals a previously held truth to actually be false.
You see a troubling vision of a future for a friend, ally, or companion.
You may only perform this ritual and no other for a time.
You develop a strange obsession or fascination.
You affect your surroundings causing rapid growth of dangerous plants or fungus.
You are sent into a state of madness.
A friend, ally, or companion is tormented by an apparition from their past.
Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse.
The ritual has the effect of a different random ritual.
This place becomes a site of power that continually draws roaming horrors to it.
A bond is tested as a result of this ritual.
An important object is lost in shadow and reappears elsewhere.
You undergo emotional torment which leaves its mark on you.
You are filled with seemingly boundless energy that compels you to run aimlessly and recklessly.
You are inhabited by a powerful presence and proclaim a prophecy in an otherworldly voice.
You are transformed into an animal and roam the lands for a time giving way to your primitive impulses.
The ritual you performed gives an advantage to an adversary.
You have lethargy and dim wits for a time.
You inadvertently place a curse on the area. Ask the Oracle.
Your senses are amplified for hours and can overwhelm you.
It causes a friend, ally, or companion to behave passively.
Your ritual affects the target hours later.
Your ritual reveals a change in the nature of an iron vow you have sworn.
You are covered with boils and sores.
You see a troubling vision involving a settlement you share a bond with.
For the next significant amount of time, you can only perform this ritual at the same time of day you are performing it now.
Your sense of direction is muddled for a time causing you to add +1 to all challenge dice when making an adventure move.
Your connection to magic weakens for a day or so causing you to add +1 to all challenge dice when performing a ritual.
A memory of past failure resurfaces powerfully wracking you with guilt and causing you to hesitate at critical moments.
Dark whispers tempt you to forsake a vow.
Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse.
An assumption is revealed to be false.
A more dangerous foe is revealed.
You and an enemy share a common goal.
You are betrayed by someone who was trusted.
The truth of a relationship is revealed.
Two seemingly unrelated situations are shown to be connected.
Unexpected powers or abilities are revealed.
Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it more dramatic.
A fracture forms in a previously solid alliance.
An old foe you thought defeated returns.
The wrong person shows up at the wrong time.
A friend, ally, or companion abandons the quest.
An important item is broken or destroyed.
A reliable ability is suddenly unreliable.
You are tempted by a bribe to abandon your vow.
An odd symbol begins to show up in multiple places.  What does it mean?
A friend, ally, or companion is captured.
The weather or terrain becomes a hindrance.
A past action comes back to haunt you.
You are faced with a choice of the lesser of two evils.
A friend, ally, or companion suddenly becomes hesitant.
A trusted authority is shown to be corrupt.
A friend, ally, or companion is cursed.
It is revealed that the enemy has gathered new information about your plans.
Critical information is lost or withheld.
Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it more dramatic.
You are accused of a crime and being hunted.
An unexpected guardian impedes your progress until appeased, circumvented, or defeated.
Innocent lives are now in danger due to your actions.
Rumors spread which ruin your reputation.
Something you thought false is revealed to be true.
You are separated from an ally, friend, or companion in a troubling way.
A trap or circumstance of the environment forces you to work with the enemy to survive.
An action is much more effective than you anticipated which complicates the situation.
You discover the next destination on your journey is considered off limits by local custom and travel there could cause friction.
You draw attention to yourself in a troubling way.
An action takes much more time than anticipated causing you to meet someone or something best avoided.
An ally, friend, or companion is unexpectedly injured.
You are made to look the fool.
You lose significant support for your cause.
Something you wanted to remain hidden is revealed.
Your actions were witnessed and interpreted in a detrimental way.
A new ally appears and forcefully takes charge of the situation doing more harm than good.
A friend, ally, or companion is accused of a crime and being hunted.
Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it more dramatic.
